title: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva
summary: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva (Brazilian Portuguese: [luˈiz iˈnasju ˈlulɐ dɐ ˈsiwvɐ] (listen); born Luiz Inácio da Silva; 27 October 1945)[2] is a Brazilian politician and former union leader who served as the 35th president of Brazil from 2003 to 2010.[3] He was a founding member of the Workers' Party (PT) and ran unsuccessfully for president three times before achieving victory in the 2002 election. He was re-elected in 2006.[4]
